title: Connecting Minds: Exploring the Intersection of AI and the Social Sciences
description: Join us on September 19th at 11:00am at the Walter C. Koerner Library for 'Connecting Minds: Exploring the Intersection of AI and the Social Sciences.' The morning will start with an engaging series of 5-minute lightning talks exploring the dynamic intersection of Artificial Intelligence with education, sociology, economics, politics, culture, and language, followed by a networking lunch at noon.

title: Efficient and Long-Context GenAI Models - Sung Ju Hwang, KAIST Endowed Chair Professor, Kim Jaechul School of Artificial Intelligence and School of Computing at KAIST
description: Generative AI models have demonstrated remarkable performance across various tasks in recent years. However, their deployment in real-world production-grade AI systems is hindered by significant computational costs. Additionally, these models are constrained by their limited context window size, which restricts their ability to handle more complex tasks that require larger working memory. In this talk, I will present recent advancements from our group aimed at addressing these challenges in generative AI models.

title: Challenges and Opportunities with Multimodal LLMs - Vicente Ordóñez-Román, Associate Professor, Rice University
description: In this talk, Vicente Ordóñez-Román will provide an overview of how the field of computer vision has been impacted by the recent success of Multimodal LLMs, discussing challenges and opportunities associated with these models.

title: Frontiers in Embodied AI for Autonomous Driving - Jamie Shotton, Chief Scientist, Wayve
description: In this talk, we’ll explore what’s been holding progress back in autonomous vehicles and how Wayve is unlocking the potential of autonomous driving in complex urban environments. We’ll also discuss our latest research in multimodal learning and generative world models.

title: 2024 Constance van Eeden Seminar: Dr. Sherri Rose
description: This seminar will discuss ethical AI and its implications in health, focusing on fairness, data bias, and community engagement in research.

title: A Physical perspective on Graph Neural Networks - Michael Bronstein, Professor, University of Oxford
description: The message-passing paradigm has been the 'battle horse' of deep learning on graphs for several years, making graph neural networks a big success in a wide range of applications. We propose physics-inspired 'continuous' learning models that open up new tools from differential geometry, algebraic topology, and differential equations in graph ML.

title: Towards Interpretable Deep Learning - Lily Weng, Assistant Professor, UC San Diego
description: Deep neural networks (DNNs) have achieved unprecedented success across many scientific and engineering fields. This talk will share results on advancing explainable AI and interpretable machine learning, focusing on interpretability in deep learning and Trustworthy AI.

title: TrustML Workshop @ UBC
description: The in-person TrustML Workshop @ UBC brings together leading researchers and practitioners interested in building trustworthy machine learning systems. This workshop features invited talks, a panel, tech briefings, poster sessions, and other discussion and networking opportunities with the research community in this field.

title: Self-Play Fine-Tuning Converts Weak Language Models to Strong Language Models - Quanquan Gu, Associate Professor, UCLA
description: Harnessing the power of human-annotated data through Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) is pivotal for advancing Large Language Models (LLMs). This event discusses a new fine-tuning method called Self-Play Fine-Tuning (SPIN) that enhances LLMs without additional human-annotated data.

title: Memory-augmented Optimizers for Deep Learning and Lifelong Learning - Sarath Chandar, Assistant Professor, Polytechnique Montreal
description: In this talk, I will introduce the idea of adding external memory to standard optimization methods to improve their performance in deep learning and lifelong learning. The talk will cover new optimizers and challenges in lifelong learning.

title: AAAI 2024 Visits
description: The UBC TrustML Research Excellence Cluster and CAIDA will be hosting several talks at UBC by conference participants during the AAAI 2024 conference in Vancouver.

title: New Advances in Safe and Efficient Large Language Models - Hongyang Zhang, Assistant Professor, University of Waterloo
description: Recent strides in large language models (LLMs) have underscored the critical importance of addressing both AI safety and decoding efficiency. This talk provides valuable insights into the ongoing efforts to enhance both the safety and efficiency of large language models.

title: Inverse constraint learning and risk averse reinforcement learning for safe AI - Pascal Poupart, Professor, University of Waterloo
description: In this talk, techniques to learn soft constraints from expert trajectories in autonomous driving and robotics will be presented, along with an alternative to variance based on Gini deviation for risk-averse reinforcement learning.

title: TrustML for Society - December
description: TrustML for Society brings together leading researchers and practitioners interested in building trustworthy machine learning systems: systems that are reliable, secure, explainable, and ethical. This workshop features two invited talks and networking opportunities to foster connections that strengthen our vibrant research community in the area.

title: Vancouver Institute Talk - Understanding Artificial Intelligence - Kevin Leyton-Brown, Professor, UBC
description: This event features Dr. Kevin Leyton-Brown discussing his research in computational game theory and machine learning applications. It is an in-person event and will not be live streamed, but a recording will be available later.

title: Operationalizing Counterfactual Metrics: Incentives, Ranking, and Information Asymmetry - Serena Wang, PhD Student, UC Berkeley
description: This event discusses the misalignments of metrics in healthcare and how counterfactual metrics can be modified for better alignment with patient welfare.

title: Querying AI: Social Science and Humanities Perspectives on AI in Research and Politics
description: This event explores the intersection of AI with social science and humanities, featuring discussions on generative AI, its implications, and workshops on using AI in research.

title: Imaging the Future
description: Join clinicians, researchers, students, engineers, innovators, and industry professionals for an insightful evening of exploration at our exclusive panel and networking event in Vancouver as part of the INOVAIT Imaging the Future event series.

title: Achieving Codec Telepresence - Michael Zollhoefer, Director, Reality Labs Research (RL-R), Meta
description: Enabling a Codec Telepresence system that is indistinguishable from reality, allowing people to communicate as if they were co-present in the same room.

title: Gore Robots: From Blood and Guts to Bits and Bytes - Juan Wachs, Professor, Purdue University
description: Robots can already solve sophisticated problems ranging from playing games, autonomous driving, and dancing. This talk emphasizes strategies and techniques to address fundamental challenges in emergency medicine, focusing on surgical assistants, telesurgery, and skill augmentation.

title: Diffusion Models: From Foundations to Image, Video and 3D Content Creation - Karsten Kreis, Senior Research Scientists, NVIDIA’s Toronto AI Lab
description: Denoising diffusion-based generative models have led to multiple breakthroughs in deep generative learning. This talk provides an overview of recent works on diffusion models and their applications for digital content creation.

title: Reconstructing Training Data from Model Gradient, Provably - Qi Lei, Assistant Professor, NYU
description: Understanding when and how much a model gradient leaks information about the training sample is an important question in privacy. This talk presents a surprising result: we can fully reconstruct the training samples from a single gradient query at a randomly chosen parameter value, suggesting potential severe threats to privacy, especially in federated learning.

title: PLAI Talk: Generative AI, Stable Diffusion, and the Revolution in Visual Synthesis - Björn Ommer, Professor, LMU
description: This talk will contrast the most commonly used generative models with a focus on denoising diffusion probabilistic models and discuss latent diffusion models, which improve the efficiency of diffusion models for visual synthesis.

title: CVL Talk: Towards Reducing Human Efforts in Visual Perception and Beyond - Kaicheng Yu, Alibaba Group
description: Although GPT-based AI models have achieved widespread popularity, their virtual nature restricts their ability to reduce human effort in physical tasks, highlighting the importance of robots in realizing genuine AI democratization. At Alibaba, we have deployed over 700 autonomous vehicles for delivery, and we have identified that there are two major challenges preventing further scaling up.

title: CVL Talk: Multi-Object Tracking and Pose Estimation for Animals - Urs Waldmann, University of Konstanz
description: Pose estimation and tracking are among the fundamental problems in computer vision and crucial tasks in many vision applications ranging from sports to human-computer interaction to the study of collective behaviour. This talk will show how to bridge the gap between the lack of annotated animal data and the need for real-time multi-animal pose estimation and tracking for the study of collective behaviour.

title: CVL Talk: From Video to Unsupervised Semantic 4D Reconstruction - James Tompkin, Browns
description: Pose estimation and tracking are among the fundamental problems in computer vision and crucial tasks in many vision applications. This talk will address the gap between the lack of annotated animal data and the need for real-time multi-animal pose estimation and tracking for the study of collective behaviour.

title: CIGF 2024: Canada on the world stage
description: This year’s program focuses on how to leverage Canada’s unique strengths in internet governance and global affairs as the internet community steps up to bat in multilateral dialogues that will shape our shared digital future for decades to come.

title: Labour Day Events 2024
description: Various events celebrating Labour Day across Canada, including parades, picnics, and community gatherings.

title: Nova Scotia Municipal Election Candidate School
description: This candidate school will be your opportunity to ask questions, how to talk about the issues facing people in your community, ways to fundraise for your campaign and best practice for door-to-door canvassing and so much more.

title: 2024 Pride Festivities Across Canada
description: Over the next few months, Canada’s unions will join others in communities across Canada to celebrate Pride and support 2SLGBTQI+ equality and justice. Show your support at an event near you.

title: CLC Ontario Summer School 2024
description: Ontario’s unions help lift everyone up, whether it’s improving workplaces, fighting for political gains, or advocating for social justice – unions and our members make all the difference. This year we are thrilled to be bringing back the highly sought after Canadian Labour Congress Ontario Summer School and Women’s School!

title: CLC Ontario Women’s School 2024
description: Ontario’s unions help lift everyone up, whether it’s improving workplaces, fighting for political gains, or advocating for social justice – unions and our members make all the difference. This year we are thrilled to be bringing back the highly sought after Canadian Labour Congress Ontario Summer School and Women’s School!

title: Action Network Basics Training: Toronto
description: Join the CLC for a three-day Action Network basics workshop led by facilitator, Beth Becker. This in-person and hands-on training helps you learn the platform’s basic functions to help address knowledge gaps and build confidence in using digital tools for campaigning and organizing.

title: Day of Mourning Ceremonies 2024
description: April 28th is the labour movement’s most solemn day, dedicated to mourning workers killed or injured on the job and refocusing on preventing future workplace injuries and deaths.

title: February 14th Women’s Memorial March Honouring Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women, Girls, and Two-Spirit Peoples (MMIWG2S+)
description: On February 14, communities across Canada will hold Women’s Memorial Marches to remember and honour missing and murdered Indigenous women, girls and two-spirit people. Show your support and solidarity by participating in a march in your area.

title: Training: How to lobby for universal public pharmacare to make life more affordable
description: Whether you’re meeting with your MP online or in-person, we’ll teach you everything you need to know to tell MPs why workers need universal public pharmacare with confidence. Don’t miss out—sign up now and learn how to become a lobbying powerhouse!

title: How to lobby for good, sustainable jobs
description: Whether you’re meeting with your MP online or in-person, we’ll teach you everything you need to know to tell MPs why workers need good, sustainable jobs with confidence. Don’t miss out—sign up now and learn how to become a lobbying powerhouse!

title: GPAI Innovation Workshop
description: A workshop focused on innovation in AI, presented by CEIMIA and other partners.

title: CIFAR Talks: Women in Research
description: In celebration of International Women’s Day, CIFAR brings together a dynamic panel of brilliant interdisciplinary women who have dissected the politics of race and identity, made groundbreaking discoveries in the microbiome and pioneered responsible AI.

title: Watch: CIFAR Talks: Nurturing a Resilient Earth
description: This virtual talk features an interdisciplinary panel of researchers discussing novel approaches to address climate change and its impacts, moderated by Stephen Toope, President & CEO of CIFAR.

title: CIFAR Talks: Future Cities
description: On World Cities Day, join CIFAR for a panel discussion that uncovers what we must anticipate in order to shape thriving cities of the future.

title: CIFAR Virtual Talks: Appeals to human dignity: do they make a difference?
description: Join us as members of CIFAR’s Boundaries, Membership & Belonging program, Will Kymlicka and Evan Lieberman, take us through research that explores whether reminders of our common humanity is sufficient to generate support for vulnerable groups.

title: CIFAR Virtual Talks: AI agents among us: causality and reinforcement learning
description: How can AI systems become better at planning, reasoning, making decisions, and adapting to their digital environments? This event is free and open to the public.

title: CIFAR Virtual Talks: Life in the deep biosphere
description: Join us for a fascinating interdisciplinary discussion between CIFAR fellows Jason E. Stajich and Magdalena Osburn about life in the deep biosphere. This event is free and open to the public.

title: Race & Research
description: Join CIFAR on Nov.23, for an exclusive conversation with our new President and CEO Stephen Toope and journalist Angela Saini. They will discuss Saini’s latest book, Superior: The Return of Race Science, and explore how race science and created race hierarchy still affect ideas, policies, and systems in society and the economy.

title: CIFAR Massey Talks: Disruptive innovation and opportunities in renewable energy and AI
description: Chemistry is one of humanity’s oldest scientific pursuits, while quantum computing and AI are emerging and potentially world-changing fields. Mixing them together is what leads to disruptive innovation.

title: Believe the Impossible: CIFAR Celebrates 40 Years
description: Forty years ago, CIFAR introduced a disarmingly simple model and it has changed the world. From kickstarting the AI revolution to groundbreaking work on quantum computing, CIFAR makes an impact on science and humanity.

title: Watch CIFAR Virtual Talks: Unhackable: The future of quantum computing and cybersecurity
description: Free, and open to the public, join us as we bring high-impact research from CIFAR’s fellows, chairs, scholars and advisors to the forefront. This event discusses how quantum algorithms can be used to solve emerging problems in cybersecurity and quantum computing.

title: CIFAR Virtual Talks: Superconductors: the next tech superstar?
description: Free, and open to the public, join us as we bring high-impact research from CIFAR’s fellows, chairs, scholars and advisors to the forefront. Join us for an exciting discussion with Quantum Materials members Pablo Jarillo-Herrero and Alannah Hallas on harnessing superconductivity for future applications.

title: CIFAR Virtual Talks: Do robots help us live better lives?
description: Free, and open to the public, join us as we bring high-impact research from CIFAR’s fellows, chairs, scholars and advisors to the forefront. As artificially intelligent robots become more advanced – how can they be used to help us live better lives?

title: Watch CIFAR Virtual Talks: How do we get to net-zero?
description: Free, and open to the public, join us as we bring high-impact research from CIFAR’s fellows, chairs, scholars and advisors to the forefront.

title: Watch CIFAR Virtual Talks: What actually killed the dinosaurs?
description: Free, and open to the public, join us as we bring high-impact research from CIFAR’s fellows, chairs, scholars and advisors to the forefront. The culprit for the dinosaurs’ demise 65 million years ago may not have been a catastrophic meteor, but something much, much smaller: fungi.

title: Synthetic Data for Health Symposium
description: AI algorithms and intelligent systems hold great promise in the health sector, such as decreasing the cost of supporting an aging population, discovering new therapeutic avenues for complex disease such as cancers, and better patient management. To support future advances in the Canadian healthcare system with data intelligent algorithms, barriers to data access and privacy must be addressed, and many scientists are turning toward generative models and synthetic datasets for innovative solutions.

title: CIFAR Massey Talks: The future of vaccines
description: Join us for the latest CIFAR Massey Talks event that gives a glimpse into the future of vaccines and their impact on human health. Moderated by Wency Leung, health reporter at The Globe and Mail, we’ll hear a diverse range of perspectives and expert commentary from health leaders Derrick Rossi, founder of Moderna and Alan Bernstein, President & CEO of CIFAR.

title: Watch Now: Behind the Headlines: COVID and Our Children
description: As rates of infections within children soar in the U.S., and with approximately 75 per cent of eligible children and teens fully vaccinated in Canada, COVID raises many questions for what the school year will look like. Moderated by award-winning health reporter and columnist, André Picard, join Candice Odgers and Brett Finlay as they take you behind the headlines, making sense of uncertain times, and discussing the latest studies around COVID-19 and children.

title: CIFAR Virtual Talks: Is the future of computing quantum?
description: Join CIFAR Associate Fellow Dave Bacon and CIFAR Fellow Stephanie Simmons as they explore what quantum has in store for computation.

title: Global Call The Future of Being Human – Information Webinar
description: CIFAR’s third Global Call for Ideas is soliciting proposals for new CIFAR programs related to The Future of Being Human. The webinars will provide applicants with more information about the call.

title: CIFAR Virtual Talks: Can AI be conscious?
description: What would it take to make an AI conscious? Interdisciplinary researchers Blake Richards and Anil Seth joined to unpick the fact from the fiction of conscious AI.

title: Watch Now: The Economist & CIFAR Special Event: How Science Can Save the World
description: Join CIFAR for a special public event in partnership with The Economist: How Science Can Save the World. Scientific discovery has lengthened life expectancies, fed the world and taught humanity about our planet and the universe that surrounds it. Scientific methods are also to thank for the unprecedented speed with which Covid-19 vaccines have been developed.

title: CIFAR Virtual Talks: What is the next big threat?
description: As the pandemic taught us, our interconnected world is fragile. As we begin to get COVID-19 under control and look to the future, what are the next big threats, and what if they come not from well-studied viruses or bacteria, but from little-known fungi? Join two of the world’s foremost experts on fungal pathogens, Leah Cowen and Mat Fisher, as they discuss how this long-overlooked kingdom may be harbouring our next greatest enemy.

title: CIFAR Virtual Talks: Growth and equity – can we have both?
description: How can we spread the benefits of innovation more equally to ensure everyone prospers? Join Fellows in CIFAR’s Innovation, Equity & the Future of Prosperity program Dan Breznitz and Woody Powell as they explore the inclusive innovation policies that will help us build back better.

title: Cifar Virtual Talks: What is a “healthy” brain?
description: CIFAR Co-director and Koerner Fellow Adrian Owen and CIFAR Azrieli Global Scholar Megan Peters discuss the optimal conditions for our brains, including sleep needs and the impact of COVID-19 on brain health.

title: Watch Now: The search for life as we don’t know it
description: Earth is the only place in the Universe where we know life definitely exists. But does that mean life, if it exists elsewhere, will always thrive in Earth-like conditions, with our particular set of chemicals, temperatures, and pressures?

title: CIFAR Massey Talk: How social relationships get under the skin
description: The quality of our relationships with other people—both friendly and competitive—has a dramatic effect on our health. This talk addresses how social lives translate into changes in our genes and immune systems.

title: Watch Now: Inheriting emotional trauma
description: The latest research suggests that many animals, including humans, pass trauma on to their children through epigenetic markers. Knowing this, could the pandemic trauma of lost lives, jobs, and opportunities have effects that ripple through generations? CIFAR Azrieli Global Scholar alumnus Brian Dias discussed the latest findings from his research on intergenerational trauma.

title: Watch Now: The hidden costs of COVID-19 on children
description: Even if they avoid the worst direct effects of the virus, children may be particularly sensitive to the longer-term stressors of the COVID-19 pandemic caused by the economic downturn and social distancing policies. Join CIFAR Fellows Meghan Azad, Michael Kobor, and Candice Odgers as they investigated how the pandemic will affect children’s brains, immune systems, and ability to thrive.

title: Watch Now: Next Generation Diagnostic Tests
description: The core of any effective response to COVID-19 must be a robust testing strategy. On September 10, 2020, CIFAR Fellow Eran Elinav and CIFAR Azrieli Global Scholar Naama Geva-Zatorsky joined CIFAR’s Rachel Parker to discuss their research on COVID-19 diagnostic tests.

title: Watch Now: The sick & the healthy: how can we help each other?
description: On August 20, Alan Bernstein and Arturo Casadevall discussed the state of rapid research into treatment and protection of COVID-19 patients. What can we learn from the 19th century technique of using antibody-rich plasma from survivors to treat the sick? What is the state of affairs with respect to international vaccine development? What unites these two tracks and what separates them?

title: Watch Now: Building a Learning Health System for Canadians
description: On August 6, Kim McGrail, Professor at University of British Columbia and Scientific Director, Health Data Research Network Canada, joined CIFAR’s Elissa Strome to discuss how access to data from across Canada could revolutionize our understanding of health and disease.

title: Watch Now: Governance, Tech and the Pandemic
description: On July 28, Carly Kind, Director, Ada Lovelace Institute and Michael Geist, Canada Research Chair at the University of Ottawa, joined CIFAR’s Rebecca Finlay to discuss the impact of contact tracing apps in Canada and the UK. What do the debates on contact tracing apps in both countries tell us about broader governance questions related to AI? How can policy makers navigate these questions effectively?

title: Building the Tech Coalition
description: CSET hosted a half-day conference featuring distinguished speakers who discussed the military’s application of AI and software, covering the results of a joint project with the Army’s 18th Airborne Corps, Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory, and CSET.

title: Privacy, Security, and Innovation – Friends Not Foes
description: Join us for a discussion on how privacy-enhancing technology infrastructure can support better AI innovation, featuring CSET's Helen Toner and OpenMined's Andrew Trask.

title: 2024 Canada Youth Internet Governance Forum
description: Free in person and virtual full day event discussing the most pressing Internet governance topics in Canada from a youth perspective.

title: Democracy has its day in America: U.S. Ambassador David Cohen at TMU
description: On the eve of a dramatic presidential election on Nov. 5, U.S. Ambassador to Canada David Cohen will discuss bilateral ties and share an American perspective on how Canadians view the U.S. This free event is open to all students and the general public, with advance registration required.

title: Canada's Democracy Summit
description: DemocracyXChange connects, celebrates and equips people who are taking action to strengthen democracy and civil society. Join us at OCAD University and TMU in Toronto, in April 2025, as we take on today’s most urgent civic issues.

title: Colloque du CRDM sur la cybersécurité
description: Cet événement rassemblera des expert.e.s de renommée internationale, des chercheur.e.s éminents, des professionnel.le.s de recherche, des stagiaires postdoctoraux et des étudiant.e.s passionnés du domaine de la cybersécurité.

title: Journée de la recherche en Science et Génie
description: La Journée de la Recherche en Science et Génie est une occasion d’entrer en contact avec les membres de la communauté de recherche de la Faculté et de découvrir les opportunités de collaboration.

title: Adaptabilité des modèles fondations
description: Dans cette présentation, le scientifique de la défense Mathieu Pagé Fortin analysera comment les modèles fondations, grâce à leur formation sur des données massives et diversifiées, peuvent être adaptés pour résoudre efficacement des tâches spécialisées.

title: Montreal AI Symposium 2024
description: Le Montreal AI Symposium vise à rassembler des experts et des professionnels intéressés par les avancées fondamentales et les applications de l’intelligence artificielle, en mettant l’accent sur l’apprentissage automatique, l’apprentissage profond et les approches connexes.

title: Modèles causaux et inférence causale en médecine et assurance
description: Toute la communauté IID (étudiant.e.s, chercheur.e.s, professionnel.le.s) est invitée au premier séminaire étudiant de l'IID, double conférence offerte en mode hybride. L'activité sera consacrée aux modèles causaux et à l'inférence causale en médecine et en assurance.

title: Le traitement de données massives: la fondation de l’IA
description: Cette présentation offerte par Richard Khoury, professeur à la Faculté des sciences et de génie de l’Université Laval, vise à mettre la lumière sur les différents concepts et défis du traitement de données massives.

title: L'IA générative au service de l'apprentissage: perspectives et enjeux pédagogiques
description: L’usage de l’IA générative dans le domaine de l’éducation représente une révolution majeure, offrant des opportunités sans précédent pour améliorer les méthodes d’enseignement et d’apprentissage. Regard sur la question avec Ange Tato, professeure adjointe à la Faculté des sciences de l’éducation de l’Université Laval.

title: L'IA générative et le droit: propriété intellectuelle, opportunités et gouvernance des contenus synthétiques
description: À travers des exemples pratiques et surprenants, cette présentation de Vincent Bergeron, avocat et associé chez ROBIC, abordera les défis posés par l’utilisation de l’intelligence artificielle dans la création de contenu, en se concentrant spécifiquement sur les implications en matière de propriété intellectuelle.

title: Données personnelles: reprenons le pouvoir! - Guide pour une gouvernance citoyenne du numérique
description: Ce webinaire mettra en évidence divers modèles de gouvernance et modes d’engagement pour permettre à chacun de nous de participer à la définition des usages de nos données lors de ce webinaire.

title: NLP in the era of generative AI, cognitive sciences, and societal transformation
description: Join us at Mila in October for a three-day workshop to explore the transformative potential of language technologies and their implications for society.

title: SRI Seminar Series: Terry Flew, “Trust and communication: The question of mediated trust”
description: Our weekly SRI Seminar Series welcomes Terry Flew, professor of digital communication and culture at the University of Sydney, who will explore issues surrounding public trust in media communications in the context of contemporary political polarization, disinformation, and digital economies.

title: Endless Summer School (ESS): Fine-Tuning and Alignment
description: Join us for a 2.5 hour webinar in the Endless Summer School series, focusing on the foundations of fine-tuning and alignment in AI projects. This session will explore how to refine AI models for specific tasks, ensuring they meet desired performance criteria. We’ll cover practical techniques, best practices, and real-world applications, providing attendees with the knowledge to enhance AI effectiveness and reliability.

title: AI Summit & Career Fair 2024
description: Join us for Vector's 7th Annual AI Summit & Career Fair on Friday, September 20, 2024 at The Carlu in Toronto, a premiere event that brings together the brightest minds in AI. This highly anticipated gathering offers a unique opportunity for Vector AI graduate students, researchers, alumni, and Vector sponsor organizations and industry experts to connect, collaborate, and explore the future of AI.

title: Applied AI Projects Insights: Fine tuning and Alignment Bootcamp
description: Join the Collaborative Projects team as we explore insights from Vector Institute’s Applied AI projects in collaboration with industry sponsors and thought leaders.

title: Vector Business Insights (VBI): AI Skills Development
description: This 2-hour webinar in the Vector Business Insights series will cover strategies for attracting top AI professionals, effective training programs, and real-world success stories. Attendees will learn best practices for building a robust AI team and fostering continuous learning, equipping their organizations with the skills needed to thrive in an AI-driven landscape.

title: Applied AI Projects Insights: Diffusion Models
description: Join the Collaborative Projects team as we explore insights from Vector Institute’s Applied AI projects in collaboration with industry sponsors and thought leaders.

title: Endless Summer School (ESS): ICLR and ICML 2024 Conference Highlights
description: Join us at 'ESS: ICLR and ICML 2024 Conference Highlights' on Thursday, November 21, from 10:00 am – 12:00 pm ET, a seminar in the Endless Summer School series. This event will cover highlights from the International Conference on Learning Representations (ICLR) and the International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML), which both took place in Vienna, Austria this past May and July respectively.

title: Applied AI Projects Insights: Gen AI Governance Roundtable
description: Join the Collaborative Projects team as we explore insights from Vector Institute’s Applied AI projects in collaboration with industry sponsors and thought leaders.

title: Applied AI Projects Insights: Deployment of AI Models
description: Join the Collaborative Projects team as we explore insights from Vector Institute’s Applied AI projects in collaboration with industry sponsors and thought leaders.

title: Applied AI Projects Insights: Change Management for AI
description: Join the Collaborative Projects team as we explore insights from Vector Institute’s Applied AI projects in collaboration with industry sponsors and thought leaders.

title: Applied AI Projects Insights: MLA Program (TBA)
description: Join the Collaborative Projects team as we explore insights from Vector Institute’s Applied AI projects in collaboration with industry sponsors and thought leaders.

title: Applied AI Projects Insights: AI Safety Bootcamp
description: Join the Collaborative Projects team as we explore insights from Vector Institute’s Applied AI projects in collaboration with industry sponsors and thought leaders.

title: Self-study courses
description: Courses with freely available materials for independent learning.

title: Hurtig Lecture on the Future of Canada: Canada's Role in Shaping Our AI Future
description: Discover how Canada’s strengths, culture and values influence the responsible global development of AI. This event features a discussion on Canada's opportunity to shape the future of AI and a cross-disciplinary panel discussion on the implications and innovations of AI in various fields.

title: Life Sciences Week 2024
description: Amii is proud to sponsor Life Sciences Week 2024. Organized and led by Applied Pharmaceutical Innovation (API), the week celebrates and showcases Alberta's burgeoning life sciences sector with events throughout the province.

title: Upper Bound 2025
description: Upper Bound is an annual AI conference for students, academics, business professionals, and enthusiasts leading the way in shaping a positive AI future. Attendees can expect a collaborative environment, with lots of opportunities to have fun and make meaningful connections along the way.

title: Upper Bound 2026
description: Upper Bound is an annual AI conference for students, academics, business professionals, and enthusiasts leading the way in shaping a positive AI future. For four days, thousands of attendees worldwide gather in Edmonton, AB, for AI-focused learning, discussions, debates and collaboration.

title: Upper Bound 2027
description: Upper Bound is an annual AI conference for students, academics, business professionals, and enthusiasts leading the way in shaping a positive AI future. For four days, thousands of attendees worldwide gather in Edmonton, AB, for AI-focused learning, discussions, debates and collaboration.

title: Hurtig Lecture on the Future of Canada: Canada's Role in Shaping Our AI Future
description: Discover how Canada’s strengths, culture and values influence the responsible global development of AI. This event features a discussion on Canada's opportunity to shape the future of AI and a cross-disciplinary panel discussion on the implications and innovations of AI in various fields.

title: Life Sciences Week 2024
description: Amii is proud to sponsor Life Sciences Week 2024. Organized and led by Applied Pharmaceutical Innovation (API), the week celebrates and showcases Alberta's burgeoning life sciences sector with events throughout the province.

title: Upper Bound 2025
description: Upper Bound is an annual AI conference for students, academics, business professionals, and enthusiasts leading the way in shaping a positive AI future. Attendees can expect a collaborative environment, with lots of opportunities to have fun and make meaningful connections along the way.

title: Upper Bound 2026
description: Upper Bound is an annual AI conference for students, academics, business professionals, and enthusiasts leading the way in shaping a positive AI future. For four days, thousands of attendees worldwide gather in Edmonton, AB, for AI-focused learning, discussions, debates and collaboration.

title: Upper Bound 2027
description: Upper Bound is an annual AI conference for students, academics, business professionals, and enthusiasts leading the way in shaping a positive AI future. For four days, thousands of attendees worldwide gather in Edmonton, AB, for AI-focused learning, discussions, debates and collaboration.

title: AI & Warfare - What are the critical questions?
description: Join Ask AI podcast host Melissa Kargiannakis for this free online event that will feature an open and interactive discussion about the implications of using artificial intelligence technology in warfare.

title: Women in Data
description: Join as we bring leaders in the field of data science to share their views on the current landscape, their experience in the field and the opportunities for women.

title: Women in RegTech
description: A networking event for women in the regulatory technology sector, focusing on innovation and collaboration.

title: Attributions of Consciousness to Artificial Agents
Fitness Event
description: An engaging fitness event encouraging participants to stay active and socialize.

title: Workshop on Radical and Critical Approaches to Mental Health II
description: The workshop, organized by Larisa Svirsky, Anne-Marie Gagné-Julien, and Zoey Lavallee, is co-sponsored by the Centre de Recherche en éthique, Montréal (CRÉ), the Centre for Ethics, University of Toronto (C4E), and the Canada Research Chair on Epistemic Injustice and Agency (CRC-IAE).

title: In the memory of Charles W. Mills
description: Lectures by Souleymane Bachir Diagne (Columbia U.) and Chike Jeffers (CRC in Africana Philosophy, Dalhousie U.).

title: Philosophy of social movements
description: Workshop organized by Christian Nadeau for the Department of Philosophy at the University of Montreal and the Centre de recherche en éthique (CRÉ). The event will be held in French.

title: Annabelle Lever (Science Po, Paris)
description: Annabelle Level (Science Po, Paris) will be presenting her work. More information to come. The lecture will be followed by a discussion chaired by Charles Blattberg (UdeM).

title: The Montreal Workshop on Emotions and Normativity
description: The Montreal Workshop on Emotions and Normativity will feature keynote speakers and additional speakers from various universities discussing topics related to emotions and normativity.

title: Charting the Course: Navigating Climate Justice in the Digital Age
description: This event will explore the intersection of climate justice and digital technology, featuring panels on climate misinformation, environmental data justice, and the impacts of tech and AI on climate justice.

title: Bill C-63 Unpacked: Making the Internet Safer for Kids
description: Bill C-63 Unpacked: Making the Internet Safer for Kids will dive into how the proposed bill requires social media platforms to minimize users’ risk of exposure to seven kinds of online harms, to responsibly design products likely used by children, and to immediately takedown two types of content: intimate images shared without consent, and child sexual abuse material. This virtual roundtable will be moderated by Taylor Owen and Emily Laidlaw, featuring panelists from various organizations.

title: Bill C-63 Unpacked: Criminal Code and Human Rights Act Hate Speech Amendments
description: In this second roundtable of our series on the Bill, we will discuss Bill C-63’s proposed amendments to the Criminal Code and Canadian Human Rights Act. Our panel will unpack what the amendments mean in practice, the risks and benefits.

title: Virtual Roundtable on the Online Harms Act: Featuring Members of the Expert Advisory Group on Online Safety to the Government of Canada
description: The Centre for Media, Technology and Democracy presented a virtual roundtable to discuss initial reactions to the Online Harms Act (Bill C-63) by five members of the Expert Advisory Group on Online Safety to the Government of Canada.

title: Evolving U.S. Media Perceptions of Canada in a Changing World: How our neighbours to the south see their neighbors to the north
description: A panel discussion among Canada-based journalists writing for U.S. media news outlets. This event is free, but registration is required.

title: Youth Assembly on Digital Rights and Safety
description: We're gathering a diverse group of 39 Canadian 18-year-olds to talk about how you understand, interact with, and hope to change online platforms. We want to hear your thoughts on how emerging digital rights can help promote your well-being, safety, and success online. You'll have the chance to speak with academic experts and policymakers and share your own experiences of the digital world.

title: The Platform Governance Research Network Conference 2023: Imagining Sustainable, Trustworthy, and Democratic Platform Governance
description: The two main research days of the conference will happen virtually on April 3rd and April 4th, with sessions running between 1100-1700 UTC on each day. Confirmed sessions include panels on a wide range of topics, ranging from the regulation of labour platforms to content moderation in the global context.

title: Women In Tech Welcome Mixer (Sydney)
description: Come along to our Welcome Mixer on 17th September, 5:30-7:30pm at the Amazon Sydney Office! This event is designed to kick off the launch of our new AWS User Group, bringing together women who interested in AWS, cloud technology, and advancing careers in tech.

title: Weak to Strong Generalization
description: At this event, Owen Parsons will outline the current understanding for why weak-to-strong generalisation happens, and its implications for aligning super-intelligent AI models.

title: Predictive Models
description: Rubi Hudson will introduce us to Predictive Models, how they might help address existential risks from AI, as well as some of the dangers and caveats of this approach.

title: Sparse Autoencoders
description: Getting here: Enter the lobby at 100 University Ave (right next to St Andrew subway station), and message Giles Edkins on the meetup app or call him on 647-823-4865 to be let up to room 6H. Neural networks - and transformers in particular - exhibit an irritating phenomenon. When trying to interpret each individual neuron, it is often polysemantic: activating in two or more seemingly unrelated contexts. It's been theorized that specific linear combinations of neurons known as 'features' might provide a better map into the workings of a transformer's mind. Joshua Carpeggiani will guide us through one particular technique for finding these features, known as sparse autoencoders (SAE). We'll see how it helps with interpretability! We welcome a variety of backgrounds, opinions and experience levels.

title: An Overview of the Frontier AI Labs
description: What are the different frontier AI labs' attitudes towards safety? What kinds of safety agenda (if any) are they prioritizing? Annie will guide us. We welcome a variety of backgrounds, opinions and experience levels.

title: Epoch AI: Can AI Scaling Continue Through 2030?
description: Epoch AI recently released a report estimating the amount AI training runs will continue to scale up by 2030. They could get big, and expensive, and deliver a lot in terms of increased capabilities. Luke Frymire from Epoch will walk us through the report and explain where the key bottlenecks will be in AI scaling over the next few years. We welcome a variety of backgrounds, opinions and experience levels.

title: Hallucination Detection & Interpretability
description: Getting here: Enter the lobby at 100 University Ave (right next to St Andrew subway station), and message Giles Edkins on the meetup app or call him on 647-823-4865 to be let up to room 6H. We all know that Large Language Models (LLMs) can confidently emit falsehoods, a phenomenon known as hallucination. Joshua Carpeggiani will tell us about some interpretability methods - peering into the insides of the model and making sense of what we see - that might help detect and correct hallucinations. We welcome a variety of backgrounds, opinions and experience levels.

title: How to Contribute to AI Risk Reduction
description: Getting here: Enter the lobby at 100 University Ave (right next to St Andrew subway station), and message Giles Edkins on the meetup app or call him on 647-823-4865 to be let up to room 6H. Some of you want to help out, and that's great! Giles will guide through some of the best resources available today for those of us wanting to address the most severe harms from AI. The focus will be on how to get doing cool stuff quickly, and how to stay networked with the community. We welcome a variety of backgrounds, opinions and experience levels.

title: Weekly AI Safety Meetup
description: Getting here: Enter the lobby at 100 University Ave (right next to St Andrew subway station), and message Giles Edkins on the meetup app or call him on 647-823-4865 to be let up to room 6H. We welcome a variety of backgrounds, opinions and experience levels.

title: Weekly AI Safety Meetup
description: Getting here: Enter the lobby at 100 University Ave (right next to St Andrew subway station), and message Giles Edkins on the meetup app or call him on 647-823-4865 to be let up to room 6H. We welcome a variety of backgrounds, opinions and experience levels.

title: Weekly AI Safety Meetup
description: Getting here: Enter the lobby at 100 University Ave (right next to St Andrew subway station), and message Giles Edkins on the meetup app or call him on 647-823-4865 to be let up to room 6H. We welcome a variety of backgrounds, opinions and experience levels.

title: CRDM conference on cybersecurity
description: Université Laval's Centre de recherche en données massives (CRDM) launches the first edition of its Colloque sur la cybersécurité. This event will bring together internationally renowned specialists, researchers, postdoctoral fellows and students, offering a unique platform for sharing innovative ideas, discoveries, techniques and recent tools related to the practical and theoretical aspects of cybersecurity.

title: A roundtable of researchers and immigration professionals
description: This roundtable will discuss the effects of automation and AI on immigration management in Canada, featuring lead Canadian immigration lawyers and researchers. It is part of the IMM-AIA seminar series.

title: Artificial Intelligence and Copyright: The Canadian Dilemma
description: This event discusses the implications of artificial intelligence on copyright law in Canada, exploring key concepts and contemporary issues related to algorithmic creations and human input in artistic works.

title: ADOR-IA
description: The inaugural Workshop on Responsible Development and Operationalization of AI, co-organized by IVADO, Obvia, and SEMLA, focusing on responsible AI practices and mentorship for students in relevant fields.

title: Launch of Artificial Intelligence, Culture and Media
description: In the form of a panel discussion, the launch will highlight selected authors and chapters from the book Artificial Intelligence, Culture and Media, edited by Véronique Guèvremont and Colette Brin.

title: Launch of the State of Play report on the societal impacts of artificial intelligence and digital technology
description: Obvia is pleased to invite you to the launch of the first edition of the État de la situation sur les impacts sociétaux de l'intelligence artificielle et du numérique. This new annual publication takes stock of current research knowledge within the scientific community, highlighting current advances and gaps while guiding future research into the societal impacts of AI and digital.

title: Action IA: Together for responsible development and adoption in industry
description: This event aims to facilitate cross-sector dialogue on the responsible deployment of AI in different industrial sectors, bringing together industry specialists and researchers to discuss ethical and responsible AI practices.

title: Interdisciplinary Dialogues: Rethinking culture in the age of AI
description: As part of the Interdisciplinary Dialogues series, Obvia, IVADO and Mila invite you to the Rethinking Culture in the Age of AI panel on the challenges and impacts of generative AI on the cultural and creative industries.

title: Cybercrime - An ecosystem approach to digital space
description: This is the second in a series of lectures on key works in the field of law, cyberjustice and cybersecurity. In the form of a reading circle, Prof. Benoît Dupont will present his work, and a referee from another discipline, in this case Prof. Hugo Loiseau, will comment on it.

title: Round table Politics in the age of artificial intelligence
description: The Politics in the Age of Artificial Intelligence round table is for those passionate about the use of AI in politics. This discussion promises to spark lively debate between guest panelists and will be presented free of charge.

title: The Walls Have Eyes
description: A Conversation on Migration in the Age of AI with Petra Molnar around her new book exposing experimental AI surveillance technology sharpening of borders around the globe.
